You can create an LogReturn indicator that does not automatically update. This lets you update the indicator with any data you choose. The following reference table describes the LogReturn constructor.

LogReturn()1/1

            LogReturn QuantConnect.Indicators.LogReturn (
    *string                       name,
    Int32                        period,
   )

Creates a new LogReturn indicator.

Parameters
*string name (Optional) The custom name of the indicator whose log return we seek.
Int32 period The period of the log return.

Return

LogReturn - log return indicator for the requested name.

Definition at file Indicators/LogReturn.cs.


You can update the indicator automatically or manually.

Automatic Update

Create a consolidator and then call the RegisterIndicator method to update the indicator with the consolidated bars.

private LogReturn _logr;

// In Initialize()
_logr = new LogReturn(period);
_logr.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _logr, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_logr.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _logr.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.logr = LogReturn(period)
self.logr.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.logr, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.logr.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.logr.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually enables you to control when the indicator is updated and what data you use to update it. To manually update the indicator, call the Update method that with time/decimal pair. The indicator will only be ready after you prime it with enough data.

private LogReturn _logr;
private Symbol _symbol;

// In Initialize()
_logr = new LogReturn(period);
_symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;

// In OnData()
if (data.ContainsKey(_symbol))
{
    _logr.Update(data[_symbol].EndTime, data[_symbol].High);
}
if (_logr.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _logr.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.logr = LogReturn(period)
self.symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol

# In OnData()
if data.ContainsKey(self.symbol):
    self.logr.Update(data[self.symbol].EndTime, data[self.symbol].High)
if self.logr.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.logr.Current.Value
